Topic.Title: I don't understand this reaction

Message.Msg: First of all, my bonds are in corporate bonds and they are safer than stocks. The only bonds I hold that are Fed bonds are US saving bonds drawing 4%. The corporate bonds total more than $700K, but are drawing 5.59%, however many of the bonds that I hold were purchased at a discount. For example: Merrill Lynch bonds purchased at $560 now worth over $1000 and paying 11%. On June 1st, I will be receiving over $4000 from 3 corporations. Yesturday, I received over $300 from two corporations paying monthly. Most of the bonds pay on the 15th of the month. Some of the bonds are paying 8% which are tied to the S&P between 600 and 900.

No one knows whether or not the 8.5 billion settlement will be allowed to stand, however.... a lot of folks want the abuses to be forgotten (despite the fact that the abuses are worse than ever now), so, most likely, the 8.5 billion settlement will be allowed to proceed because: BofA is too big to fail, and the US Government arm-twisted BofA into buying that crooked company, Countrywide, and so, at some point this matter will have to be allowed to go the way of the do-do bird, otherwise, this matter will go on in perpetuity, and, there are bigger fish to fry now. Just one humble opinion.

That said, I just don't see a path for it to get to anything near $100 in 5 years. I'm just hoping it gets up to 30 in that time. That would be pretty sweet by itself, but a recovery is going to have to show itself and have some jobs attached to it vs. what's been seen so far.

Topic.Title: ( Bac ) is Cash Rich,Has more in Cash Than Most of Companies even Make in 5yrs.... Tading Below BOOKVALUE of $20.19

Message.Msg: Keep in mind that cash for banks is a lot different than cash for other companies. Unlike Apple, this isn't a pile that the bank can distribute. There are many regulatory requirements on the cash and cash equivalents that banks are required to have to meet immediate and short term contingencies.

Message.Msg: I didn't know schools in Oklahoma were being built by FEMA. When did the federal government take over school house construction? that should sure reduce the local real estate tax bite which usually funds schools. Strange they would build them without safety criteria. I wasn't aweare that the Sandy victims or even a Katrina victims stood around waiting for FEMA to start rebuilding. Have they already built a new home in the afflicted area in Oklahoma? Last I saw the governor was asking people to stay away and no one was protesting that it not be declared a disaster area. It was certainly to their credit that they were somewhat prepared and took action that reduced fatalities, Even those heroic school teachers, union or not, behaved admirably.

Message.Title: IMF chief questioned over alleged fraud and misuse of public funds in 2008 :Chirstine Lagarde may be subject to criminal investigation
Message.Msg: Chirstine Lagarde may be subject to criminal investigation IMF chief questioned over alleged fraud and misuse of public funds in 2008 Christine Lagarde, the director of the International Monetary Fund, may be formally placed under criminal investigation on suspicion of being an accessory to fraud and the misuse of public funds when she completes two days of questioning by a French court today. Ms Lagarde is not suspected of personal enrichment, but of incompetence, negligence or having been instrumentalised by the former president Nicolas Sarkozy to reward a political ally, the businessman and ex-convict Bernard Tapie, with a €403 million out-of-court settlement in 2008. A spokesman at IMF headquarters in Washington yesterday said the board has confidence in Ms Lagarde’s ability to fulfil her duties. The fund made a similar statement after Ms Lagarde’s Paris apartment was searched by police in March. ‘Assisted witness’ The special court was created to try cabinet ministers for offences committed while in office. Ms Lagarde was Mr Sarkozy’s finance minister from 2007-2011. The two-day hearing takes place behind closed doors. If Ms Lagarde is not placed under investigation, she may be ascribed the less serious legal status of “assisted witness”, which would nonetheless leave her at the beck and call of the court. French cabinet ministers are required to resign if they are placed under criminal investigation, but Ms Lagarde is not expected to step down at the IMF. If she did, she would be the second former French finance minister to leave the IMF in disgrace, following Dominique Strauss-Kahn
